header.title: Kleenex bins MANSIZE tissues: Why is Kleenex are getting rid of MANSIZE tissues?
header.subtitle: KLEENEX has announced it will be binning man-sized tissues in a shock twist to the company’s long-running product line. Why has Kleenex got rid of man-sized tissues?
header.postText: 'Kleenex is dropping a long-held brand name from their product lineup due to public backlash.', 'The company is known for their paper-based products ranging from facial tissue to women’s hygiene products.', 'Established in 1924, Kleenex is one of the longest-running tissue companies, and their brand for men is almost as old.', 'The tissue company has decided to rebrand their man size tissues after 60 years.', 'Kleenex has ditched the man size branding in favour of ‘Extra Large’ after backlash over their name.', 'Customers had complained the brand is sexist, taking to Twitter to voice their concerns.', 'Many said the World is changing and the parent company to Kleenex Kimberly-Clark has apparently been at the receiving end of annoyed customers.', 'The ‘Mansize’ Kleenex for men brand was launched initially in 1956, and claimed to stay strong when wet by the company.', 'Talking to the Daily Telegraph, a spokesman for Kimberly-Clark said complaints are directed towards gender concern.', 'He said: Kimberly - Clark in no way suggests that being both soft and strong is an exclusively masculine trait, nor do we believe that the Mansize branding suggests or endorses gender inequality.', 'Nevertheless, as we remain committed to developing the best possible products for our consumers and take any feedback extremely seriously, we decided to renovate our current product and update the product sub-brand as Kleenex Extra Large.', 'The move has come alongside Waitrose’ s own branding change from similar pressures.', The supermarket giant had decided to change their Gentleman's Smoked Chicken Caesar Roll’ also due to sexism allegations.', 'Part of Heston Blumenthal 's supermarket range, it contains anchovy mayonnaise, similar to Gentleman's Relish anchovy paste.', 'Waitrose later issued an apology and has vowed to change the naming.', 'The issue was initially brought up by Night Tsar Amy Lane, the first appointed to the role by Sadiq Khan.', 'Taking on Twitter, she said: I never knew sandwiches were gender specific. I'm female but thankfully Waitrose let me purchase this anyway.', 'Ms Lane shared the image with Everyday Sexism, an online organisation which documents day - to - day incidents of casual sexism.', 'A Waitrose spokeswoman said: It's never our intention to cause offence - we're not dictating who should eat this sandwich.', 'We hope anyone who tries it will love the distinctive flavours.', 'However, we are planning to change the name of the sandwich soon.'
